s2.message: Having problems with Adblock Plus? This list of known issues may help you quickly solve them. Download Adblock Plus for Chrome and other platforms here.

s4.message: Having problems with Adblock Plus? This list of known issues may help you quickly solve them. Download Adblock Plus for Chrome and other platforms here.

s5.message: The following lists issues known to affect Adblock Plus. If your problem isn't listed, please check the forum and create a new topic if necessary (registration is not required).

s6.message: Installation fails with error message "Signing could not be verified"

s8.message:
Outdated browsers such as early Firefox 3.0 releases will be unable to verify signing of
the Adblock Plus package.

s9.message: Solution: Verify that your browser meets the system requirements, update to the current version if necessary.

s11.message: Adblock Plus packages are signed to prevent unauthorized modification. This error message might indicate such modification when installing from third-party websites.

s14.message: To verify Adblock Plus signature the browser needs to accept certificates issued by StartCom Ltd. On systems where the certificate store is independent of the browser the certificate store might be outdated and prevent recognition of the signature.

s15.message: Affected: Some Linux distributions (only distribution-supplied browser builds)

s16.message: Solution: Update "nss" package to version 1.3.1 or higher. See "Cause 4" for an alternative solution.

s18.message: The certificate store is misconfigured on some systems and certificates issues by StartCom Ltd. are marked as not trusted. This prevents recognition of Adblock Plus signature.

s21.message: encryption/certificates tab of the browser options

s22.message: and click "View certificates". Under "Authorities" find "StartCom Certification Authority", click it and click "Edit". Make sure all fields are checked and confirm by clicking OK.

s23.message: Installation fails with other error message (e.g. -228 or -203)

s24.message: For other installation issues, please refer to the

s28.message: Adblock Plus icon and Adblock Plus entry in Tools menu don't appear after installation

s30.message: When opening the Add-on Manager (menu Tools / Add-ons) and finding Adblock Plus under extensions, the entry is gray rather than black (disabled).

s31.message: Solution: Click the Adblock Plus entry in Add-on Manager and click the "Enable" button.

s33.message:
This can happen due to a browser crash after updating from Adblock Plus 2.0.x to a newer
  Adblock Plus version.

s38.message: and then immediately enable it again. No browser restart required.

s40.message:
If the path to the user profile changes, e.g. when using Firefox Portable
  on different computers, all restartless extensions will stop working.

s42.message: Solution: Update to Firefox 15 or higher. If that isn't possible,

s45.message: and then immediately enable it again (no browser restart required).

s46.message: Firefox cannot open new browser windows

s47.message: Cause: Zone Alarm Spy Blocker Toolbar extension

s48.message: This issue is caused by Ask Toolbar 2.1.0.5 extension (particularly the variation called "Zone Alarm Spy Blocker Toolbar") due to use of bad coding practices.

s53.message: Adblock Plus doesn't block any ads

s55.message: Adblock Plus won't block anything "by itself", if you declined to add a filter subscription after Adblock Plus installation it won't have any effect unless you define filters manually. More info

s56.message: Solution: Add a filter subscription (ideally one matching your language) from the list.

s57.message: Cause 2: Adblock Plus filter database got corrupted

s58.message: For some people the Adblock Plus filter database gets corrupted occasionally (very rare event, usually only happens once) resulting in their filter list becoming empty (can be verified by going to menu Tools / Adblock Plus preferences). The root cause of this problem is currently unknown.

s59.message: Solution: Re-add a filter subscription from the list. Alternatively, restore the filter database from automatically created backup:

s64.message: Open the "adblockplus" subdirectory of the profile.

s66.message: Note that patterns.ini is small (less than 1 KB), remove it.

s67.message: Rename patterns-backupN.ini into patterns.ini (where N is a number -- take the first file that is larger than 1 KB).

s69.message: Adblock Plus can be disabled temporarily, which can be recognized by a gray ABP icon as opposed to the customary red color.

s70.message: Solution: Enable Adblock Plus by clicking on the ABP icon with the middle mouse button or by right-clicking the icon and checking "Enable Adblock Plus" in the context menu.

s71.message: Adblock Plus doesn't block redirects in Firefox Mobile 4

s73.message: Affected: Adblock Plus 1.3.6 and higher on Firefox Mobile 4

s74.message: Solution: Currently none, the bug needs to be fixed in a future version of Firefox Mobile.

s75.message: Do Not Track header isn't sent in Firefox Mobile 4 despite

s77.message: Cause: Do Not Track is currently not supported in Firefox Mobile 4

s78.message: Solution: Currently none, future Adblock Plus versions might add support however.

s79.message: Tabs on Flash and Java don't appear reliably

s80.message: Cause: Adblock Plus doesn't know when to display the tab

s81.message: Affected: Adblock Plus 1.1 and higher on Fedora Linux

s82.message: Solution: Use official browser builds instead of the distribution-supplied builds.

s85.message: Unfortunately, not all Adblock Plus translations are equally well-maintained. Some miss the deadline before an Adblock Plus release or even stop being updated altogether.

s86.message: Solution: Help translate Adblock Plus into your language!
